newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Two Kazakhs electrocuted stealing copper wire.
newsitem.headline: Two Kazakhs electrocuted stealing copper wire.

text.p: Two people were electrocuted in eastern Kazakhstan as they tried to steal copper wires from a high-voltage electricity transmission line, the official Kazakhstanskaya Pravda daily reported on Tuesday.

The paper said one of the thieves turned into ashes and another died shortly after they were hit by a charge of 10 kilovolts. Earlier that day both had already stolen around 300 kg (650 pounds) of copper wire, it said.
Purchasing scrap non-ferrous metals from the population and exporting them to other countries has become a lucrative business in the vast former Soviet republic.
